page.title: 02QUICKE'S FARM NEWTON ST.C.
page.content: The cows eat silage and straw and the pigs eat it too. They give the pigs the whey that came from the cheese factory. If they eat too much whey they get 'tummy ache' and are sick. The number of animals is{302 cows and {160 pigs.} There are{17 tractors}and most of them are John Deere because they are{four wheel drive}and will go over rough ground better than the old tractors. There are{43 people working {on the farm including the cheese {factory. Dung is pumped into a cuboid shaped pit where it is thinned out.Later it is pumped into a large lagoon (or pong pond as Mary Quicke calls it). The {slurry}is dried out to be put on the land.{Some villagers have complained {about the smell.
